SDG_TARGET:
9.1

Develop quality, reliable, sustainable and resilient infrastructure, including regional and trans-border infrastructure, to support economic development and human well-being, with a focus on affordable and equitable access for all
SDG_INDICATOR:
9.1.1

Proportion of the rural population who live within 2 km of an all-season road
STAT_CONC_DEF:
Indicator available

Percentage of HHs that are within 2km to an all-weather road by region (Urban and Rural)

Definition

This indicator refers to the proportion of households having access to an all-season road within 2km to the total number of households using the facility.

According to the context of Rwanda, an all-season road is defined as a road that is open to traffic regardless of weather, season and construction materials 2 kilometres
DATA_COMP:
The indicator is calculated as:

n / N x 100

Where

n: denotes the total number of households having access to an all-season road within 2km.

N: denotes the total number of households using all-season road.
DOC_METHOD:
Link to global metadata

United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata (PDF 4.0 MB)
COVERAGE:
Geographical coverage

National

Disaggregation

  • National, Province and Residence (Urban/Rural)
  • Wealth quintiles
  • Type of habitat
indicator_name: Proportion of the rural population who live within 2 km of an all-season road
graph_title: Proportion of the rural population who live within 2 km of an all-season road
